sub_title: CEO | Board Director | Mentor | Royal Dutch Shell | Aditya Birla Group | Energy & Chemicals | Forest to Fashion
summary:
Kalyan Ram Madabhushi, 55, is an accomplished CEO and Board Director with more than 33 years’ experience in running global businesses in multi-regional & multicultural environments predominantly based out of Singapore (1995-2006), Europe (2006 to 2018) and now in Mumbai (2018-2023), with expertise in transformation/change and versatility in growing businesses in a variety of industries.  

The urge to return to India in 2018, having left the country in mid 1990s, was made easy when a challenging assignment was offered at Aditya Birla Group to lead the Group’s $ 3.0 billion Global Chemicals business (Chlor-Alkali & Advanced Materials) together with 3 other flagship entities (Indo-Gulf Fertilisers, Aditya Birla Insulators & Wood based textile filament yarn produced at Century/Indian Rayon entities). 
It's been an amazing few years with the team, establishing two new major JVs (US partner and German partner respectively), a Technology acquisition (US start-up), 2 divestments (Chemicals & Fertilizers) and ensuring significant investments are committed (securing the business future).

It's been my pleasure to work with Royal Dutch Shell for more than 2 decades, an organisation that was a learning institution in itself, in various senior leadership roles within Energy & Chemicals Industry. 

1. Having had an opportunity to be based in two different continents, initially in Singapore (1995-2006) and thereafter at the Netherlands (2006-2017), I had the privilege of striking wonderful relationships & partnerships with colleagues and customers across Americas, Europe/Africa and Asia Pacific & Middle East.  

2. Every challenge that I experienced in my 22 years at Shell, be it Transformation/Change, P&L roles at Global/Regional level, Board/JV Governance roles in Europe and Mentoring Asian/European leaders thought me enough to start giving back to the new organisation as well as the society large.

Techno-Commercial education with a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering (NIT) and an MBA  in International Business (IIFT) and an executive leadership learning at IMD Switzerland and University of OXFORD, helped shape who I am!

I developed aptitude for mentoring young entrepreneurs in Europe/Asia and delivered leadership lectures as visiting faculty for business schools and student communities in France, Singapore and the Netherlands. But I am able to relax and enjoy a work-life harmony when I spend time with family, listen to Classical Music, Reading and learning new developments but an intense Badminton session takes my mind off everything.

profile_positions.description:
Birla Cellulose is a $ 3.0 Billion World leader in Manmade Cellulosic Fibres (MMCF) from Forestry, Dissolving Grade Pulp (Sweden, Canada and India), Wood based Cellulosic Fibres with manufacturing in SE Asia, China and India) and LIVA fashion. 

Birla Cellulose is a 100% nature-based cellulosic fibre, ideal for apparel, home textile, & nonwoven applications with a focus on sustainability, innovation and partnership.

The product portfolio includes Livaeco™ by Birla Cellulose, Birla Modal™, Birla Excel™ , Birla Viscose™ ,Birla Spunshades™.Birla Cellulose fibres are of natural origin, moisture absorbent, have soft feel, and are completely biodegradable. As an Extremely versatile and easy to blend, Viscose Staple Fibre by Birla Cellulose is widely used in apparels, home textiles, & nonwoven applications.

volunteer_experiences.description:
Winner of the Audience Award : Young entrepreneurs Eldert Besseling and Hugo Ekkelenkamp developed a method for constructing mud dikes. More sustainable and considerably less expensive than the materials used in the construction of traditional flood defences. 

The LiveWIRE Audience Award afforded them access to strategic advice from Kalyan Ram, General Manager Solvents with Shell Chemicals Europe.
“We’re very happy to have Kalyan as our mentor. It was clear from our initial meeting that he is capable of addressing many of the issues we are facing within a very short space of time, thanks to his wealth of experience. He’s already given us useful advice that we have put to immediate use to help us develop our business plan,” Eldert Besseling says. “His international experience will also help us to make the right choices for our international strategy.”
